intro: Arjona ruscifolia, commonly known as the woolly arjona, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. Arjona ruscifolia is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
